mdscssControl

Class MDSCSSController

  • java.lang.Object
    • mdscssControl.MDSCSSController

  • public class MDSCSSController
extends java.lang.Object
    The MDSCSSController is a utility object utilized by the control thread. This object contains interface definitions to the major subsystems, and utility functions utilized by the control thread to control the system.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void approveForgivingAssignment()
      The approveForgivingAssignment function is called by the MMODFRame if the operator has approved the current assignment in the forgiving mode of control.
      void approveForgivingDet()
      The approveForgivingDet function is called by the MMODFrame if the operator has approved the current detonation choice in the forgiving mode of control.
      void checkForFailure()
      The handleSocketFailure function is called when the control thread is attempting to establish connection.

      The cmdMcssDestruct function sends the destruct command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor.

      The cmdMcssDetonate function sends the detonate command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor.

      The cmdMcssGetCtrlVersion function queries the MCSS for the version string of a specific interceptor controller.

      The cmdMcssLaunch function sends the launch command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor.

      The cmdMcssThrust function ends the thrust command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor, each power level will persist for 1 second of duration.

      The cmdSmssActivateSafety function sends the activate command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.

      The cmdSmssDeactivateSafety function sends the deactivate command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.

      The cmdSmssDestruct command sends the destruct command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.

      The cmdSmssDetEnable command sends the detonate enable command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.

      The cmdSmssGetVersion queries the SMSS for its version string and parses out the version number.

      The disableWatchdog function disables the safety for all interceptors.

      The establishConnection function is called by the control thread to establish a connection with all the subsystems.
      boolean establishStatus()
      The establishStatus function is called by the control thread to get the version of each subsystem, as well as their connection status.
      void finalize()
      The finalize function safely closes each TCP socket to the subsystems and stops the Control Thread.
      MDSCSSController.controlMode getControlMode()
      The getControlMode function retrieves the current system control mode.
      java.lang.String getForgivingAssignmentState()
      The getForgivingDetState function is called by the MMODFrame on a regular basis to determine whether or not a prompt should be presented to the operator to approve or disprove an assignment while in the forgiving control mode.
      java.lang.String getForgivingDetState()
      The getForgivingDetState function is called by the MMODFrame on a regular basis to determine whether or not a prompt should be presented to the operator to approve or disprove a detonation while in the forgiving control mode.
      void handleControlLogic()
      The handleControlLogic function is called periodically by the control thread to handle automatic or forgiving control logic dictated by the system control mode.
      void handleThrustControl()
      The handleThrustControl function is called by the control thread every second to determine the power levels of each in-flight interceptor and send the thrust commands.
      void handleWatchdogTimer()
      The handleWatchdogTimer function is called by the control thread every 0.5 seconds to notify the SMSS that the MDSCSS is still operational.
      void initialize(MissileDBManager pModel, MMODFrame pView)
      The initialize function initializes the controller on startup.
      void initializeModel()
      The initializeModel function is called by the control thread when connection is first established.
      void initializeWatchdog()
      The initializeWatchdog function is called by the control thread after connection with the subsystems and the missile database is initialized.
      void rejectForgivingAssignment()
      The rejectForgivingAssignment function is called by the MMODFRame if the operator has rejected the current assignment in the forgiving mode of control.
      void rejectForgivingDet()
      The rejectForgivingDet function is called by the MMODFrame if the operator has rejected the current detonation choice in the forgiving mode of control.
      void setControlMode(MDSCSSController.controlMode pMode)
      The setControlMode function sets the system control mode.
      void updateModel()
      The updateModel function is called by the control thread every 0.5 seconds to update the internal missile database entries with new information from the TSS and MCSS.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MDSCSSController

        public MDSCSSController()
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(MissileDBManager pModel,
                       MMODFrame pView)
        The initialize function initializes the controller on startup. References to the view and model are established and initial socket connections to the subsystems are performed the function also ensures that the control thread is started.
        Parameters:
        pModel - Reference to the Missile DB Manager object
        pView - Reference to the MMODFrame GUI Object

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
        The finalize function safely closes each TCP socket to the subsystems and stops the Control Thread.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object

      • establishConnection

        public boolean establishConnection()
        The establishConnection function is called by the control thread to establish a connection with all the subsystems.
        Returns:
        true if all subsystems have been connected over TCP, false if there is at least one subsystem that has been unable to connect.

      • establishStatus

        public boolean establishStatus()
        The establishStatus function is called by the control thread to get the version of each subsystem, as well as their connection status. This function also pushes this data to the MMODFrame so that the operator is notified of each subsystem's connection status and version.
        Returns:
        true if all subsystems versions have been retrieved, false if there is at least one subsystem that has been unable to be contacted for its version.

      • checkForFailure

        public void checkForFailure()
        The handleSocketFailure function is called when the control thread is attempting to establish connection. if connection is attempting to be re-established after a failure, this function maintains track if 5 minutes have elapsed since the failure. If not, this function alerts the GUI and detonates all airborne interceptors.

      • initializeModel

        public void initializeModel()
        The initializeModel function is called by the control thread when connection is first established. This function populates the internal missile database.

      • initializeWatchdog

        public void initializeWatchdog()
        The initializeWatchdog function is called by the control thread after connection with the subsystems and the missile database is initialized. This function enables the safety for all interceptors.

      • disableWatchdog

        public void disableWatchdog()
        The disableWatchdog function disables the safety for all interceptors.

      • handleWatchdogTimer

        public void handleWatchdogTimer()
        The handleWatchdogTimer function is called by the control thread every 0.5 seconds to notify the SMSS that the MDSCSS is still operational.

      • updateModel

        public void updateModel()
        The updateModel function is called by the control thread every 0.5 seconds to update the internal missile database entries with new information from the TSS and MCSS.

      • handleThrustControl

        public void handleThrustControl()
        The handleThrustControl function is called by the control thread every second to determine the power levels of each in-flight interceptor and send the thrust commands.

      • getControlMode

        public MDSCSSController.controlMode getControlMode()
        The getControlMode function retrieves the current system control mode.
        Returns:
        A controlMode enumeration value that corresponds with the systems control state

      • setControlMode

        public void setControlMode(MDSCSSController.controlMode pMode)
        The setControlMode function sets the system control mode.
        Parameters:
        pMode - The new system control mode

      • handleControlLogic

        public void handleControlLogic()
        The handleControlLogic function is called periodically by the control thread to handle automatic or forgiving control logic dictated by the system control mode.

      • getForgivingDetState

        public java.lang.String getForgivingDetState()
        The getForgivingDetState function is called by the MMODFrame on a regular basis to determine whether or not a prompt should be presented to the operator to approve or disprove a detonation while in the forgiving control mode.
        Returns:
        - The identifier of the interceptor to be detonated, null if there is no interceptor eligible for detonation

      • getForgivingAssignmentState

        public java.lang.String getForgivingAssignmentState()
        The getForgivingDetState function is called by the MMODFrame on a regular basis to determine whether or not a prompt should be presented to the operator to approve or disprove an assignment while in the forgiving control mode.
        Returns:
        - The identifier of the interceptor and threat to be assigned, null if there is no eligible pair for assignment

      • approveForgivingAssignment

        public void approveForgivingAssignment()
        The approveForgivingAssignment function is called by the MMODFRame if the operator has approved the current assignment in the forgiving mode of control.

      • rejectForgivingAssignment

        public void rejectForgivingAssignment()
        The rejectForgivingAssignment function is called by the MMODFRame if the operator has rejected the current assignment in the forgiving mode of control.

      • approveForgivingDet

        public void approveForgivingDet()
        The approveForgivingDet function is called by the MMODFrame if the operator has approved the current detonation choice in the forgiving mode of control.

      • rejectForgivingDet

        public void rejectForgivingDet()
        The rejectForgivingDet function is called by the MMODFrame if the operator has rejected the current detonation choice in the forgiving mode of control.

      • cmdTssTrackThreat

        public int[] cmdTssTrackThreat(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdTssTrackThreat function queries the TSS for a threat's position.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the Threat to query
        Returns:
        An array of 3 integers that represent the position in the x, y, and z plane

      • cmdTssTrackInterceptor

        public int[] cmdTssTrackInterceptor(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdTssTrackInterceptor function queries the TSS for a interceptor's position.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to query
        Returns:
        An array of 3 integers that represent the position in the x, y, and z plane

      • cmdTssGetThreatList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cmdTssGetThreatList()
        The cmdTssGetThreatList function queries the TSS for a list of known threats. Note: Per requirement, all threats are assumed to have a 2-char ID.
        Returns:
        An arraylist containing the ids of all known threats

      • cmdTssGetVersion

        public java.lang.String cmdTssGetVersion()
        The cmdTssGetVersion function queries the TSS for its version string and parses out the version number.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the version number of the TSS

      • cmdMcssLaunch

        public boolean cmdMcssLaunch(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdMcssLaunch function sends the launch command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to launch
        Returns:
        The success status of the launch command

      • cmdMcssThrust

        public boolean cmdMcssThrust(java.lang.String missileID,
                             int pwrX,
                             int pwrY,
                             int pwrZ)
        The cmdMcssThrust function ends the thrust command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor, each power level will persist for 1 second of duration.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to control
        pwrX - The power level in the x direction
        pwrY - The power level in the y direction
        pwrZ - The power level in the z direction
        Returns:
        The success status of the thrust command

      • cmdMcssDetonate

        public boolean cmdMcssDetonate(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdMcssDetonate function sends the detonate command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to detonate
        Returns:
        The success status of the detonate command

      • cmdMcssDestruct

        public boolean cmdMcssDestruct(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdMcssDestruct function sends the destruct command to the MCSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to destroy
        Returns:
        The success status of the destruct command

      • cmdMcssGetInterceptorList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cmdMcssGetInterceptorList()
        The cmdMcssGetInterceptorList function queries the MCSS for a list of known interceptors. Note: Per requirement, all interceptors are assumed to have a 2-char ID.
        Returns:
        An arraylist containing the ids of all known interceptors

      • cmdMcssgetState

        public Interceptor.interceptorState cmdMcssgetState(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdMcssgetState function queries the MCSS for a specified interceptor's state.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to query
        Returns:
        An enumeration value representing the state of the specified interceptor

      • cmdMcssGetLaunchSite

        public int[] cmdMcssGetLaunchSite(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdMcssGetLaunchSite function queries the MCSS for a interceptor's launch position.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to query
        Returns:
        An array of 3 integers that represent the launch position in the x, y, and z plane

      • cmdMcssGetVersion

        public java.lang.String cmdMcssGetVersion()
        The cmdMcssGetVersion function queries the MCSS for its version string and parses out the version number.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the version number of the MCSS

      • cmdMcssGetCtrlVersion

        public java.lang.String cmdMcssGetCtrlVersion(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdMcssGetCtrlVersion function queries the MCSS for the version string of a specific interceptor controller.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to query
        Returns:
        The version string of the specific interceptor controller

      • cmdSmssActivateSafety

        public boolean cmdSmssActivateSafety(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdSmssActivateSafety function sends the activate command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to activate the safety for
        Returns:
        The success status of the activate command

      • cmdSmssDeactivateSafety

        public boolean cmdSmssDeactivateSafety(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdSmssDeactivateSafety function sends the deactivate command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to deactivate the safety for
        Returns:
        The success status of the deactivate command

      • cmdSmssPingWatchdog

        public boolean cmdSmssPingWatchdog(java.lang.String missileID,
                                   int pTimer)
        The cmdSmssPingWatchdog function sends the safety watchdog command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to update
        pTimer - The watchdog count value to set
        Returns:
        The success status of the ping command

      • cmdSmssDetEnable

        public boolean cmdSmssDetEnable(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdSmssDetEnable command sends the detonate enable command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to enable detonation
        Returns:
        The success status of the deactivate command

      • cmdSmssDestruct

        public boolean cmdSmssDestruct(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdSmssDestruct command sends the destruct command to the SMSS for a specified interceptor.
        Parameters:
        missileID - The id of the interceptor to destroy
        Returns:
        The success status of the destruct command

      • cmdSmssGetVersion

        public java.lang.String cmdSmssGetVersion(java.lang.String missileID)
        The cmdSmssGetVersion queries the SMSS for its version string and parses out the version number.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the version number of the SMSS
